title: 12 things you never knew about Buffy The Vampire Slayer as Sarah Michelle Gellar celebrates 20th anniversary
text:
12 things you never knew about Buffy The Vampire Slayer as Sarah Michelle Gellar celebrates 20th anniversary The cult teen TV show celebrates its 20 anniversary today Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now It's hard to believe Buffy The Vampire Slayer is 20 years old! Share this video Get celebs Buffy The Vampire Slayer changed television. It was the first show of its kind and kick-started a worldwide obsession with romanticising vampires. For once, the pretty girl wasn't running away from the monsters or being saved by a man - she was the hero! Its star Sarah Michelle Gellar has paid tribute to fans on the 20th anniversary of the hit show. Friday marks 20 years since the cult classic aired on TV for the first time and Sarah Michelle, who played the titular character Buffy Summers, took to her Instagram account to thank creator Joss Whedon, a number of her co-stars and the show's fans. Read More Sarah Michelle Gellar teases Buffy comeback and a reboot with a brand new slayer Buffy the Vampire Slayer turns 20 today (Photo: Studio handout) She wrote: "20 years ago today, I had the greatest privilege to bring Buffy to your tv screens for the first time. It was a long and challenging road to get there. First the movie, then a passed over pilot presentation, and eventually a mid season time slot on a little known network. "That first season, we liked to think of ourselves as the little show that could. While we knew the potential, I don’t think any of us saw the lasting impact our show would have. As an actor, you wish for that one role where you can leave your mark and forever be remembered, with Buffy I got so much more. "She’s a feminist challenge to gender hierarchy. Buffy may have been the Chosen One, but I was the lucky one. Buffy and Angel were the ultimate human-vampire couple "Thank you to Gail Berman for always believing there was a show in that movie. Thank you to Joss Whedon, for trusting me to give life to one of the greatest female characters ever created. Thank you to David, for always being my Angel. Thank you to James for understanding that while Buffy and Spike may have been love/hate, I have nothing but love for you. Alyson, as any woman knows, you are nothing without the love and support of great female friends, so thank you for being that. Michelle, you will always hold a key to my heart. Thank you to all the incredible actors for seven seasons of amazing performances. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the incredible crew that worked tirelessly (and also really tired) to bring this show to life. "And lastly, but most importantly thank you to all of you, the fans. We made this show for you, and your unwavering support has kept this show going long past our seven years. You are everything. And always remember..."if the apocalypse comes, beep me" #buffyslays20 (sic)." Sarah Michelle, 39, also took to Twitter to celebrate her "birthday", writing: "Let's party like it's my birthday #buffyslays20 (sic)." To mark the anniversary, here are 12 things you probably didn't know about Buffy: Spike's coat James Marsters as Spike (Photo: Rex Features) The iconic floor-length leather jacket sported by Spike cost the producers $2,000 - and was promptly put on the ground for a truck to run over multiple times to give it that battered look. The mystery executive Dolly Parton was involved in the show (Photo: Getty) Though she was never credited at the end of each episode, Dolly Parton was one of the executive producers of Buffy The Vampire Slayer. What a way to make a living. Weird graves Sp ky (Photo: Fox TV) While all the books in the Sunnydale High school library were real, the huge cemetery was actually made... of Styrofoam. The star who never was Imagine what Ryan would have been like as Xander? (Photo:

Pictured: Ryan Reynolds

Los Angeles: 310-82...) Ryan Reynolds was initially in line for the role of Xander, and was even offered it - but turned it down because he had had an awful time of high school. Blondes don't always have more fun Sarah Michelle Gellar's blonde lead was no scaredy cat (Photo: PA) Show creator Joss Whedon once revealed that his inspiration for Buffy came from all the horror movies he watched as a child. With a twist; he was fed up of always seeing the blonde lead as weak and helpless, and made sure his own female protagonist would have more power. Vampire skincare Maybe she's born with it? (Photo: Rex Features) 1990s computer graphics don't come cheap - it cost the show $5,000 a pop to 'dust' a vampire with special effects. Each of the actors playing vampires needed six layers of makeup and special contact lenses. Teenage dreams Mercedes was the baby of the show (Photo: Fox TV) Mercedes McNab, who played Harmony when the series started filming in 1996, was the youngest member of the cast at 16. Her co-star Sarah was 19. Too buff-y? Nicolas Brendon as Xander (Photo: Fox TV) Nicholas Brendon had to be warned by producers to stop working out because they didn't want his character Xander looking too buff. According to Nicholas, the reason why Xander got so many good lines was because Joss Whedon based the character on himself. Laugh? She'd rather cry Ending demons: not a laughing matter (Photo: Rex Features) Sarah Michelle Gellar would tell writer David Fury to stop penning scenes in which Buffy laughs, because she hated watching herself faking laughter. In response, David would write as many comical scenes as he could to tease her. Read More The ol' switcheroo We imagine they were both pretty happy with the result (Photo: Fox TV) Sarah Michelle Gellar originally auditioned for the part of Cordelia Chase. Her co-star Charisma Carpenter tried out for the role of Buffy. They both got hired - but were given each other's parts. Other actresses who auditioned for the lead role were Selma Blair and a pre-Tom Cruise Katie Holmes. Unlikely thinspo Kate Moss inspired a generation of... vampires? (Photo: Fox TV) Druilla's gothy vibe was in part inspired by Kate Moss's '90s heroin chic look. The gift that keeps on giving The Buffy cast celebrate 20 years of the show (Photo: Rex) Having enjoyed enormous success during its original run, Buffy The Vampire Slayer has had 20 years to gain even more fans. Famous people who have sung the show's praises include Ed Sheeran, who even sampled the song Remembering Jenny in his own track, Afire Love. Like us on Facebook
